snippet: Prime Minister Hesham Qandil drew heavily from the ranks of creaking state institutions to form his government, lowering expectations of sweeping change.
abstract: Egyptian Pres Mohamed Morsi swears in members of his first cabinet, marking another milestone in country's difficult transition even as continuing reports of violence complicate the new government's work; makeup of cabinet, which includes mostly technocrats and longtime state employees, has lowered expectations for sweeping change.

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and MAYY EL SHEIKH

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Hesham Qandil drew heavily from the ranks of creaking state institutions to form his government, lowering expectations of sweeping change.

headline.seo: New Egyptian Cabinet Includes Many Government Holdovers
headline.main: New Egyptian Cabinet Includes Many Holdovers
headline.print_headline: Egypt Swears In Cabinet Of Mostly Cautious Choices
